title: Their Pilgrimage
description: The Pilgrimage is the charming and slightly wistful tale of the sympathetic Mr. King and his travels to various posh vacation spots, in 19th century U.S.A. The Catskills, Atlantic City, New Port etc. pubOne.info present you this new edition. When Irene looked out of her stateroom window early in the morning of the twentieth of March, there was a softness and luminous quality in the horizon clouds that prophesied spring. The steamboat, which had left Baltimore and an arctic temperature the night before, was drawing near the wharf at Fortress Monroe, and the passengers, most of whom were seeking a mild climate, were crowding the guards, eagerly scanning the long facade of the Hygeia Hotel.
author: Charles Dudley Warner
